skill.name: Senior Frontend
skill.description: Comprehensive frontend development skill for building modern, performant web applications using ReactJS, NextJS, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS. Includes component scaffolding, performance optimization, bundle analysis, and UI best practices.
skill.summary: Complete frontend development toolkit with React, Next.js, and TypeScript automation tools
skill.author: Claude Skills

security_audit.summary: This skill contains benign documentation and utility scripts. All 58 static findings are false positives: TypeScript code examples were misidentified as shell execution, YAML frontmatter delimiters were flagged as crypto algorithms, and markdown headings about anti-patterns were flagged as reconnaissance. The Python scripts only perform standard file I/O for project analysis and documentation generation.

content.user_title: Build modern web apps with React and Next.js
content.value_statement: Frontend development requires handling component architecture, performance optimization, and code organization at scale. This skill provides automated tooling and best practices for building production-ready React applications with TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS.
actual_capabilities: Generate React and TypeScript components with proper structure and imports
Analyze frontend bundle size and identify optimization opportunities
Scaffold new frontend projects with modern stack configuration
Apply React patterns including hooks, compound components, and state management
Optimize Next.js applications for performance and SEO
Generate production-ready code following established best practices
limitations: Does not execute npm install or build commands directly on user systems
Does not access user environment variables or secrets
Does not modify production code without explicit user approval
Does not deploy applications to cloud platforms

use_cases.title: Scaffold React components
use_cases.description: Generate new React components with TypeScript, props, and styling following best practices

use_cases.title: Optimize bundle size
use_cases.description: Analyze frontend bundles and identify large dependencies for tree-shaking optimization

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Generate consistent component patterns across team codebase with documentation

prompt_templates.title: Create Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new React component called [ComponentName] in TypeScript. Include proper TypeScript interfaces for props, handle loading and error states, and use Tailwind CSS for styling.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Bundle
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the bundle size of my Next.js application at [project-path]. Identify large dependencies and suggest optimizations for code splitting.

prompt_templates.title: Setup Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a new Next.js project with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and proper folder structure following modern React patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my React component at [file-path] and refactor it to use proper hooks, memoization, and separate business logic from presentation.

output_examples.input: Create a Button component with variants
output: Generates Button.tsx with variants (primary, secondary, danger)
Uses Tailwind CSS classes for styling
Reports total bundle size by chunk
Suggests dynamic imports for heavy components
Creates Next.js + TypeScript + Tailwind project structure
Generates components folder with atomic organization
Sets up testing with Jest and React Testing Library

best_practices: Use TypeScript interfaces for all component props to ensure type safety across the application
Separate business logic from presentation using custom hooks for reusable state management
Optimize bundle size by lazy loading routes and using dynamic imports for heavy components
anti_patterns: Avoid prop drilling through multiple component layers; use context or state management instead
Do not put all state in useState; prefer useReducer for complex state logic
Avoid inline function definitions in JSX render to prevent unnecessary re-renders

faq.question: What React versions are supported?
faq.answer: Supports React 18 and newer with hooks-based patterns. Works with Next.js 13+ App Router.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: It generates new files and suggests improvements. All modifications require explicit user approval before execution.

faq.question: Can I customize component templates?
faq.answer: Yes, templates are configurable through script options. Custom templates can be added to the references directory.

faq.question: What styling approaches are supported?
faq.answer: Tailwind CSS is primary. Can generate CSS Modules, styled-components, or plain CSS on request.

faq.question: Does this work with React Native?
faq.answer: Core patterns apply. Use the component generator with React Native project structure for mobile development.

faq.question: How does bundle analysis work?
faq.answer: Scans build output to report chunk sizes, identifies large dependencies, and suggests optimization strategies.
